Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cream together butter and sugar until smooth. Add eggs and vanilla, mixing well. In a separate bowl, mix flour, baking soda, and salt. Add to creamed mixture. Drop by heaping tablespoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees f. For 11-14 minutes or until light golden. Transfer cookies to wire rack to cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter an 8-inch square, 3-inch deep baking pan or casserole. Cook spinach in a skillet over medium heat until crisp. Drain off all but 1 tbls of the bacon grease. Add the onion to skillet and fry until tender but not browned, about 3 minutes. Beat the eggs in a large bowl, then add the spinach, flour and milk. Stir until well blended. Pour into prepared pan. Cover top with cracker crumbs and dot with butter. Bake until a knife inserted in center comes out clean, about 20 to 30 minutes.

Preheat the broiler. Drain the beans and add to a food processor or blender. Add pesto, lime juice, garlic, cumin, salt, parmesan cheese, extra virgin olive oil and process or blend until smooth. Cut the baguette into 1-inch slices and brush the remaining tablespoons of olive oil over them, then broil on the lower rack until lightly browned. Put the toasted baguette slices on a platter. Scrape the spread into a nice bowl and set it in the middle of the platter and serve.

In a large skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp. Using a slotted spoon, remove to paper towels to drain. Cook and stir potatoes in drippings over medium heat for 12 minutes or until crisp-tender. Add onion and green pepper. Cook and stir for 3 or 4 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain. Stir in the reserved bacon. In a large bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Add to skillet. Cook and stir until eggs are completely set. Sprinkle with cheese and let stand until cheese has melted.

Heat oil over medium-high heat in a big skillet. When hot, put in the eggplant. When they start to pop, put in the vegetables. Stir once. Add seasonings. Stir and fry for a minute. Add 3 tablespoons of water, lower heat, cover, and simmer 10-15 minutes. Stir every now and then. If vegetables stick, add a little water. Dish is done when the potatoes are tender.

Heat oil and butter in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat. When butter has melted, add half of the asparagus to the skillet with. Using tongs, distribute spears in an even layer. Cover skillet. Cook until spears are tender and still crisp, about 5 minutes. Uncover, increase heat to high and season asparagus with salt and pepper to taste. Cook until spears are tender and well-browned along one side, 5 - 7 minutes, using tongs to occasionally move spears from the center of the pan to the edge of the pan to ensure all are browned. Transfer to serving dish, adjust seasonings as needed and, if desired, squeeze lemon over spears. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350. Butter a medium baking dish. Add the oats and butter to a heatproof mixing bowl. Pour 1 cup boiling water over them and let stand 5 minutes. Stir in the milk, brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt. When well mixed, stir in the apples. Spoon mixture into the prepared dish. Cover and bake for 35 minutes, then uncover and continue to cook for 5-10 minutes, until thick and bubbly. Spoon into bowls and serve hot with cream drizzled around the cereal and a dusting of cinnamon.

Bring the stock, arborio rice, chicken stock, chicken breasts, leek, saffron strands, lemon, zest of, lemon juice, frozen peas. Cover and cook for about 20 minutes. Stir in the rice, and reduce heat to low. Cover and continue to cook for about 5 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut chicken into small cubes. In large pot mix vegetables, soups, butter and chicken. Cook on medium heat for 10 minutes. Put soup mixture in 10 x 13 inch baking dish. Unroll cresent rolls and cover mixture with unrolled cresents. Bake for 20 minutes or until cresent cover is golden brown. Let cool pie cool down for about 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 375f and butter and flour a 9-inch cake pan with high sides, line bottom with parchment paper. Finely grind almonds with 2 tablespoons of sugar in food processor. Mix yolks, 2 tablespoons sugar, lemon zest, cinnamon and a pinch of salt in a bowl until thick and smooth. Add almond mixture, stir. Separately beat egg whites until soft peaks form, then gradually add 4 tablespoons sugar, beating until egg whites are stiff but not dry. Fold half of egg whites gently into almond mixture, then add other half and finish folding in gently. Transfer to prepared pan. Bake until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, about 30-35 minutes. Cool on rack, turn out onto serving platter.

Cook beef, onion and pepper in skillet until meat is browned and vegetables are tender. Drain. Stir in tomato sauce, seasoned salt, and pepper. Blend cottage cheese and cream cheese together until fluffy. Spoon noodles into grease 10x6x2 inch baking dish. Spread cheese mixture over noodles. Pour meat sauce on top. Bake uncovered at 350 for 30 to 40 minutes or until heated through.

Cook noodles in a large pot of lightly salted water until al dente. While the pasta is cooking, place the eggs, grated cheese, parsley, salt and pepper into a mixing bowl and beat with a whisk until al dente. When the noodles are almost cooked, melt the butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Quickly drain the pasta and add it to the skillet. Toss briefly to coat it with the butter. Add the egg mixture to the skillet and using a flat wooden spoon, mix quickly together for less than a minute until the eggs and noodles become creamy and thick. Do not cook the eggs too long or they will scramble and ruin the dish. Serve immediately.

Put the potatoes in a large bowl. Sprinkle with mustard, onion, dill, pickle and eggs add to potatoes stirring in and season with salt and pepper. Adding more mayonnaise to the creaminess you desire. Serve room temperature or chilled.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Saut onion oil until tender. Add garlic, and saut for 2-3 minutes. Stir in tomatoes, and cook only until tomatoes are warm. In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, combine rice, broth, and salt. Bring to a boil. Decrease heat to low and cook, covered, until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Put chicken shreds on tempeh, mix the sauce and pour on top. Sprinkle scallions on top of salad. Bake at 350f for 25 - 30 minutes until cheese melts & chips brown.

Melt butter in saucepan over low heat. Add cashews and stir until mixture is smooth and bubby. Remove from heat and add frozen snow peas. Stir and heat though.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees and grease an 88x2 pan or 12 muffin tins. Melt butter in a sauce pan or in a 1 quart container in the microwave. Remove from heat. Add cocoa until blended, then add sugar and mix well. Add eggs, one at a time. Stir in vanilla, flour, salt & xanthan gum do not overmix. Bake 25-30 minutes. Cool and serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Mix together flour, oats, sugar, baking soda, salt and cinnamon in a medium bowl and stir with a fork to blend. Add butter and vanilla. Blend with fork until stiff dough forms. Use your hands to mix in the raisins. Divide dough in half and place halves four inches apart on baking sheet. Bake until lightly browned. Remove sheet from oven & transfer the parchment to a cooling rack to cool for 15 minutes. Transfer cookies to wire rack and cool completely.

In a large bowl, beat cream cheese until fluffy. Beat in sweetened condensed milk, lemon juice, and vanilla. Lightly swirl pie filling into cream cheese mixture. Spoon into serving dishes. Cover and chill. Garnish with almonds. Prep time includes refrigeration time.

Cook pasta until half done. Drain. Return pasta to the pot. Add cream, butter, garlic, tomato sauce, broccoli, salt and pepper. Bring to a hard boil. When noodles are fully cooked and sauce is starting to thicken, add mushrooms and stir to combine. Remove from the heat. Add cheese. Toss and serve.

Heat oil in a medium sized saucepan, add the olives, parsley, salt and pepper. Add the olives, parsley, salt and pepper. Mix together and cook for 10 minutes. Pour in the red wine, bring to the boil and simmer for another 20 minutes, uncovered. Turn up the heat and stir vigorously until the mixture has reduced to the consistency of a soft pate. This final stage will take about 5 minutes, but cooking time will depend on the thickness of the juice the chopped tomatoes are packed in. Turn into a serving dish and allow to cool. The flavours will intensify, the longer you leave the pate before eating.

Heat oil and butter in a large skillet. Add shrimp and garlic. Cook, tossing, until the shrimp starts to turn pink on the outside but is stil translucent on the inside, about 2 min. Transfer to a plate and set aside. Reduce the heat to medium and in the same skillet, melt the remaining butter. Add the shallot and cook for 30 secs, whisking constantly. Add the wine, broth, and mustard - whisking constantly. Simmer until it is as thick as heavy cream, about 5 minute. Return the shrimp to the skillet. Bring to a simmer and cook until the shrimp are opaque throughout, about 2 minute. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Add bacon, fresh onion, black-eyed peas, stewed tomatoes, cooked rice, hot sauce, garlic powder, black pepper, salt, salsa. Pour dressing over rice mixture. Stir gently to combine. Can be served immediately, or chilled for a few hours before serving.

Divide sausage mixture into 4 portions and mound each portion on one slice of bread. Top each with bocconcini slices and top with remaining bread slices. Lightly butter the outside of each panini. Cook until both sides of each panini are golden. Serve immediately. Serve warm and garnish with maple syrup and fresh fruit if desired.

Cook frozen green beans according to package directions, using lowest time given. In a large skillet, fry bacon until desired doneness. Drain on paper towel and return to skillet. Add cooked green beans, chicken broth, and onion powder to the skillet. Stir to combine. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and cook for ten minutes or until most of the liquid is evaporated, stirring occasionally.

Preheat oven to 425f. Place the potatoes in a large skillet and heat oil over medium-high heat. Stir in potatoes. Cover skillet. Cook, stirring, until potatoes are almost tender, about 12-15 minutes. Uncover, reduce heat to low. Stir in garlic, salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until potatoes are tender, about 2 minutes. Sprinkle parsley and add salt to taste if desired.

Preheat the oven to 200c, lightly grease a 29cm x 21cm rectangular flan pan, and press the pastry firmly into the pan. Trim and discard any excess pastry and chill the pastry-lined pan for 15 minutes. Spread the onions and garlic over the pastry, top with the sliced tomatoes, anchovy fillets and olives, and drizzle with the reserved oil. Bake for 40-45 minutes, until the pastry is crisp and golden. Serve.
Heat oil in frying pan and add fish cooking about 2 minutes on each side, depending on thickness, over medium-high heat. Season with salt and pepper during cooking. Serve with lemon juice.

Boil potatoes, onions and garlic, dash of salt, till potatoes are soft. Drain potatoes in colander and put into a serving dish. Stir in lemon butter and mix throughly with potatoes.

In a large microwave safe bowl, combine the sugar, cornstarch, salt, and milk. Combine well, then cook on high in the microwave for 8 minutes. Remove the bowl from the microwave. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook about 5 minutes or until onion is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed, stirring once or twice. Let stand, covered, for 15 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Drain spinach well. Saute onion and garlic in 2 tbsp of the melted butter until onion is translucent. Mix spinach with the eggs, cottage cheese, cheddar cheese, flour, and the remaining butter. Add the sauteed onions and garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into prepared dish and bake for 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 350f and grease 8-inch square pan. In large mixing bow, beat egg beaters and vanilla until frothy. Gradually add splenda brown sugar, continuing to beat after each addition. Add flour continuing to beat after each addition. Stir in apples and nuts. Pour into greased pan. Bake 30 to 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Serve warm or cool. Can be topped with whipped cream.

In a wok or large frying pan over medium high heat, saute the spinach and garlic in the oil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Transfer to a platter in the same pan, heat the wine and saute the celery or bok choy and mushrooms, stirring constantly, for 3 minutes. Add the rice, scallions and spinach. Heat through. Bake the potatoes. Scoop out the pulp, after cutting a thin slice from the length of the potato. Mash pulp to a creamy fluff with butter, hot milk, salt and pepper. Bake at 400f for 10 minutes until the egg is firm and cheese is browned.

Heat oil in large skillet over high heat. Add green beans and saute till beans are just crisp but tender, about 5 minutes. In a small bowl stir together soy sauce, minced garlic, honey and ginger. In a large skillet, cook chicken in oil over medium-high heat until almost done. Transfer chicken to a greased 13x9-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with cajun seasoning. Top with mushrooms and cheese. Cover and bake at 350f for 30-35 minutes or until chicken juices run clear.

In a large mixing bowl, dissolve sugar and jell-o in 2 cups boiling water. Add to the jell-o mixture the juice of both oranges, the zest of one orange, chopped nuts, and the entire can of crushed pineapple. Shred apples and cranberries. Add to jell-o. Mix well. Chill overnight or until set.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add potatoes and fennel and cook 5 to 6 minutes until potatoes are tender and chicken is golden. Add red onion, celery and chicken. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes or until set. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Place tuna, mayo, onion, lemon juice, old bay seasoning, salt and pepper. Mix well. Place sandwich slices on a toasted slice of bread and spread to cover slice. Cover and remove from heat. Let stand 10 to 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Fluff with fork. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
